title: Strengthening Hospitality Practical Competencies: Purpose-Based Motivational Design for Professional Mathematics Trainees

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners can connect professional mathematics concepts (e.g., statistical modeling, optimization theory) to their career goals (e.g., data scientist, financial analyst).

Learners can develop an action plan applying at least three mathematical skills (e.g., mean calculation, probability analysis, data visualization) in service/customer interaction job scenarios such as customer wait time analysis and inventory optimization, and submit a report meeting at least four out of five checklist items provided by the training institution.

Learners must complete a self-assessment report on improving service/customer response competencies within one week after the course ends, meeting the following conditions: 1) At least one example of communication skill improvement in professional development (e.g., conflict resolution dialogue records), 2) At least two strategies for enhancing customer satisfaction in social contribution (e.g., improvement cases reflecting feedback), and 3) Each case must include specific actions (based on the 5W1H framework) and measurable outcomes (quantifiable metrics).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
